content:
@Rishi Gupta PFA a very early mockup (not much done on the looks rn) of the keyboard basics section. Is this along the lines of the design you mentioned in the issue, where clicking on the keyboard icon hides/shows this section ?
Selection_058.png Selection_057.png

Another concern I had about this, this information is static contrary to all the other content in the sidebars and can take up a significant amount of real estate if kept open by default. Now, if we close it by default, then a user may need to toggle this upto 4-5 times in order to get familiar with the basic keys and then the info will no longer be of use, while to get the complete keyboard shortcut popover(which maybe more often than the basics command), the user has to go through 2 clicks same as before.
Is making this part of the onboarding process viable or maybe we can just have a icon in the right sidebar act as a shortcut to access the keyboard shortcuts popover?

Great! A few thoughts:

  • Let's put the keyboard in the lower right, so that it doesn't have to move when you click on it.
  • Let's add an x in the upper right corner of it, so that it's clearer how to close it.
  • We can add a field to UserProfile, to maintain the state of whether it's open or closed

Another concern I had about this, this information is static contrary to all the other content in the sidebars and can take up a significant amount of real estate if kept open by default

I think that's fine; the buddy list is not that useful, especially to new people.

while to get the complete keyboard shortcut popover the user has to go through 2 clicks same as before.

It's possible we should make the ? hotkey to open shortcuts more prominent? Though I think we can also do that in a later iteration.
Selection_064.png
:thumbs_up: I think that layout is great.
Great ! I'll move forward with this design.

Peek-2018-04-03-23-47.gif
@Rishi Gupta I was finally able to make the keyboard basics section stick at the bottom which I was having problem with earlier. I've posted a rough implementation of the behaviour for feedback. Please ignore the re-positioning of the keyboard icon when the section is toggled, i'm aware of that problem :)
@Shubham Padia I'd sorta been imagining the thing that appears here as something that's more of a popover that sits over the other content, rather than something that shifts the "Group PMs".
oh okay, a popover similar to the others in the app or something just limited to the sidebar?
I think something similar in feel to the gear menu.
(Though it's obviously not a menu; just thinking about how it connects to the element being clicked)
So I guess basically like the other popovers :smiley:

okay. Wouldn't opening the current popover for keyboard shortcuts accessible from the gear menu be a better option?
It shows the basics by default and the user also knows there are lots of other shortcuts than those three mentioned above.
I think the thought is having a way to access them that feels more lightweight (There would also be a button to get the full list)
Would the popover be small when compared to the general size of popovers? I think we can include some more options if we want, there's a lot of space wasted otherwise.
Yeah, it should be the right size for what we're putting into it.
oh interesting, I was imagining it as always there, similar to what is implemented.

I feel like we'll want some way to push information to users no matter what, that is "there by default and you have to manually close it". E.g. could be a link to new features, tip of the day, "your zulip trial is ending", etc.
Well, we have a banner at the top of the page for "you need to setup desktop notifications", and I think that's the right place for high-priority things.
Right sidebar is most definitely not, since it disappears entirely in narrow windows.

yeah, I'm imagining this more for informational things, like new feature releases.

But in any case, I think having it be open by default is the right thing for the keyboard shortcuts help; I think having r, n, etc will make a huge difference in your experience of zulip at the beginning.
